titlestmt.titleproper: Andrew Newman's typescript of "From a surgeon's viewpoint" 1995
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Andrew Newman's typescript of "From a surgeon's viewpoint"

bioghist.p: Founded in 1922 and part of the Shriners Hospitals for Children network, Philadelphia Shriners Hospital is one of 18 orthopedic hospitals throughout North America that provide completely free medical care to children under the age of 18 with orthopedic problems, severe burns and spinal cord injuries. The original hospital, built in 1926, has been replaced by a new building that opened in 1998. The Philadelphia hospital adjoins the Temple University Childrenâ€™s Hospital.

scopecontent.p: This is a bound copy of a paper by Andrew Newman on the history of Shriners Hospital, entitled "From a Surgeon's Viewpoint: Philadelphia Shriners Hospital, 1925-1995." In addition to providing an illustrated history of the hospital, the paper offer biographies of two of the hospital's distinguished faculty: Howard Haldeman (b. 1921) Steel and John Royal Moore (1899-1986).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
